page.title: 14Sand and Gravel Controversy
page.content: Redlands Aggregates wishes to extend into another 60 acres of arable and orchard land at Blue Crates Farm. Extraction would be for 7 years at 165000 tonnes per annum and land would be returned to agricultural use. Existing workings at Tenpenny Farm cover more tham 50 acres with about 18 acres left to be excavated. Access to the site is via a private road to the farm and material excavated is taken by road to the firm's processing plant at Thorpe-le-Soken. Local people are objecting fearing noise, dust, more heavy lorries and a drop in housing values. They also object to loss of farm land and the adverse visual impact.
